main event: An unidentified cigar-shaped or elliptical object was spotted in the sky over Fort Lauderdale, Florida on April 9, 1952.
interesting points: The object appeared to be brilliantly illuminated without a trail or exhaust visible, and was flying at a great rate of speed in a horizontal plane.
The object was sighted at an elevation of 35 degrees above the horizon, traveling from east to west at an estimated altitude of 15,000 to 20,000 feet.
The observer was a former U.S. military pilot who was greatly impressed by the object's speed, which he said was greater than anything he had witnessed before.
Two other people also reportedly witnessed the object, but were unknown to the primary observer.
The sighting was reported to the base operations at McVill AFB in Florida, and the Air Technical Intelligence Center later requested more information from the observer.
sighted object: a cigar-shaped or elliptical object that was brilliantly illuminated
witnesses: a former U.S. military pilot and two other unknown individuals
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
